results.title: Space: the frontiers and beyond
results.creator_credit: Peter Bucknall, Focus in Education and Visnews
results.brief_description: This is the spectacular story of man’s quest to conquer the last frontier. Rare archival film sequences of the landmarks of this 30 year struggle are featured, including the wartime V2 rocket development, “Sputnik”, “Earthrise”, the 1969 moon landing by Neil Armstrong, development of the shuttle and spacelab, and many other historic space moments.

results.title: Space: the final frontier
results.creator_credit: Gary Mitchell and Independent Television News (GB)
results.brief_description: Space: the final frontier details the history of the space race, using footage from both the USA and the USSR. The ancient Chinese and Greek science of astronomy eventually led to Neil Armstrong’s walking on the moon. While concentrating on the vision and success of the space programs, the video also examines tragedies such as the Challenger explosion. The video ends with a look to the future, particularly the new knowledge that the Discovery sky-ship has given us about our universe.

results.title: Space to breathe
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Geoffrey Thompson Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the many fine parks around inner Melbourne and also shows that large areas of unspoiled landscape have been set aside to provide the city of Melbourne with an extensive Metropolitan Parks system. (Includes a brief appearance of the then Premier of Victoria, Mr Rupert Hamer.)

results.title: Space science: the sun as a star
results.brief_description: Compares the sun with other stars on the basis of size, mass, temperature, brightness and composition. Gives the life story of a star and shows some of the work of scientists, including their understanding of fusion. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Space science: galaxies and the universe
results.brief_description: Describes irregular, spiral and elliptical galaxies. Illustrates quasars and the two types of stellar populations. Demnonstrates the three most prominent theories of the expanding universe. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Space science: exploring the moon
results.brief_description: Illustrates the 400-year history of lunar exploration, from Galileo’s first telescopic view to man’s first step on the moon’s surface. Identifies major surface features, using ancient maps, photographs and film. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Space science: an introduction
results.brief_description: Shows how speed and direction determine whether a space vehicle will go into orbit, fall back to earth or escape the earth. Demonstrates terms such as thrust, acceleration, G-Forces and Zero G conditions. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Space science for beginners
results.brief_description: Explains basic concepts involved in children’s questions about the solar systems, orbits, propulsion, gravity and applications of space flight.

group_works.title: Over the hill to the moon
The Milky way
group_works.creator_credit: ACI Films and United World Films

results.title: Space probes: exploring our solar system
results.brief_description: Tells the story of efforts to explore the outer regions of space from the launching of Pioneer 1 in 1958 to the program in 1964 for gaining more information about the moon, the sun, and the solar system. Examines the problems involved in collecting and relaying the information from space probes and explains how such problems are being, or will be, solved in preparation for manned space expeditions.
